body: A lot people I have asked have agreed there is something off with the Allies artillery. I personally think it has to do with the range as you can have a lot of units/structures in the way of your artillery make them impossible to take care of in some situations

Agreed wrt Artillery - Lowering its weapon range slightly from 14 (to 12?) and lowering `155mm`'s damage versus `None` very slightly could help approaches, also put the unit in more vulnerable positions. I'm assuming `None` is infantry only.

Medium & Heavy tanks - A small HP buff to these would help them "tank" better, eating an extra base defense shot or rocket. I think they should be a bit more durable and push into bases better.

MAD re-work - Differentiate it from the demo truck by removing the self destruct and letting it un-deploy. Not sure if it should become a Ukraine unit

British Spy - Get rid of this unit completely and move the normal Spy to England. I think the bonuses it grants are pretty decent. Can keep its cheap cost of $250.

Radar Dome stealth - Remove stealth detection from the radar dome. Helps phase transport and hijacker.
:+1: Especially a tank buff
:+1: Especially the british Spy
:-1:  regarding the spies. There'd be no incentive to build dogs against Germany or France then.

my suggestion for spies would be make the regular spies have a capped stealing value and dont allow them vet units, keep all other traits. This would make the British Spy a better alternative to normal spies and they are so cheaper.

> @cjshmyr 

Agreed wrt Artillery - :+1: but my preferred solution is https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10411
Medium & Heavy tanks - :+1:
MAD re-work - dunno, this is a silly unit. Maybe make it work against structures only.
British Spy - :+1:
Radar Dome stealth - :+1: but infantry should be able to detect them (unless it already works like that)

- MAD buff #10389 Could be an interesting unit, but right now feels like not enough time/resource efficient
- Tesla Tank nerf ?  #10426
- Not sure about the whole Spy discussion :/ But I'd add #10451 (British Spy cash trick)
Another option for the MAD tank is to simply remove it.
@pchote . No. :-1:  We may increse their effect of area. I think it is 10 now. 12-15 would be better.

:-1: to the spy removal from other allied factions, this removes the ability for several tactics, like powering down the enemy aa or tesla coils before an attack. What is the actual reason behind this suggestion? I didn't feel spies being over powered.

> @abcdefg30 
> this removes the ability for several tactics, like powering down the enemy aa or tesla coils before an attack

You can play as England to be able to do that, then.

> What is the actual reason behind this suggestion? I didn't feel spies being over powered.

To get rid of a duplicated unit and make factions more diverse, I think.

Removing the spy from the other two factions is just stupid. Besides the obvious strategic loss there would be no way for Germany or France to detect other spies or cloaked units like the hijacker then.

There was a discussion on the forums "How to make France more appealing for players"
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=17666&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0

Why not add more fake structures to France like Fake Power Plants and Fake Gap Generator. I was added them to my maps, if you agree this, you can just use cameos in the map.

http://resource.openra.net/maps/6357/
@MustaphaTR :+1:  Agree (especially Fake PP, great counter vs spies !)

:+1: For all of @cjshmyr's points. ~~except removing spys from other allied factions. That said I do think the British spy should be replaced by some other unique ability or unit instead. (No idea what)~~

Also if the tank buffs go ahead, I think it would be a good time to add @MicroJOo's idea for balancing the turret RoT - so that med tanks have faster turret traverse than heavies.

Personally I still want to see soviets deal with air units over water. Naval maps are a chore to play 1v1 Soviets vs Allies.

@r34ch :+1: for soviet navy. 
Could be sth that : http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Sea_Scorpion ^_^

> What is the actual reason behind this suggestion? 

It was to remove a duplicate unit while further incentivising choosing England, but I hear the controversy on this one.

> Removing the spy from the other two factions is just stupid. Besides the obvious strategic loss there would be no way for Germany or France to detect other spies or cloaked units like the hijacker then.

Sure there is: base defenses, radar dome, or radar jammer.

---

@r34ch - Agreed about navy. A couple things in mind are MiG AA, Missile Sub AA, or both. I've had the chance to play with msub's AA. I think the unit would need a cost reduction to make it accessible, and because it's a submerged unit, I had its slow-arse missile target air units. That way it was effective against helicopters or circling yaks parked over water but they could move out of the way if they were attentive. On the other hand it was a bit odd for a slow AA shot, so perhaps give it a normal rocket that explodes in a fairly short range to get the same effect.

Mig Really needs to be AA, Longbows are so why migs not. In fact this is another change i made in may maps. :+1: for it. Not sure about Missle Sub tho, it has really slow missiles for AG, not sure can they catch planes.

SAM sites buff ? 
They are very unbalanced against AA (lower range, rate of fire), they feel useless sometimes and frustrating

@cjshmyr I would like to see how AA migs work out considering allies have the longbow.

I'm just not sure about AA msubs because I think there would have to be a compromise somewhere. If it stays late game but with AA capability it isn't solving the mid game problem and would duplicate the migs role in that case. Change the msub to be mid game and more like the destroyer and then Soviets would have to loose their long distance capability to rival the cruiser (or risk the msub being OP)

Its one of those situations where as much as it might cause controversy, for the sake of balance it could be argued that a new unit could be added. But then if that happened, I would argue allies would need a land AA equivalent to the flak - which might even help reduce the basewalking AA issue. And if that happened, you could nerf AA guns instead of buffing SAM sites @ShadowA 

That would be my dream personally, which would finally plug the 'gaps' in each sides defences and make every map playable regardless of faction.

Another idea was to move the gunboat to the soviets as it is hardly used by allies and could get aa for the soviets (similiar to the RA2 sea scorpion). Anyway, I'm not really a fan of that, just throwing this in here. ^^
But soviet naval factory is a SubPen you know, (i know transport boats are not Submarine). A flak sub may be good but problem is we would need a complete new artwork for it.

@r34ch I'd be shooting for a midgame msub, as Cruiser was always kindof akin to Mammoth in sea/land superiority, but yeah I'm really not sure yet. I like the msub as-is too. MiG AA could be a starting point.

@cjshmyr Fair enough, forgot the radar jammer, although it costs more and requires the tech center.
Just tested some things with Gatekeeper.
Nothing other than dogs can detect spies. Other spies don't detect them either although I thought they were meant to. 

Spyplanes detect camo pillboxes. This seems odd. I can understand it revealing regular buildings, but a camouflaged pillbox is strange.

I also find it odd that you can not curtain air units even when they're on the ground.

While you're on the topic of naval balance, I'd like to draw your attention to #4502.

Personally, I'd probably make the gunboat an anti-sub/anti-ship boat only (maybe with torpedoes instead of depth charges), and remove the anti-sub capability from both the destroyer and cruiser. That would give purpose to the gunboat (would probably require a bit of a health buff to survive, though). MicroBit's water mines (sorry, can't find the issue/pr again) could be added to either the gunboat or destroyer to offset the missing stealth ability (or not, since it wouldn't be canon).

> Personally, I'd probably make the gunboat an anti-sub/anti-ship boat only (maybe with torpedoes instead of depth charges), and remove the anti-sub capability from both the destroyer and cruiser. That would give purpose to the gunboat (would probably require a bit of a health buff to survive, though).

:+1: I've been arguing for this for literally years.
Oh, a word of caution to whoever ends up making any changes: please think of the missions when changing anything, and update them accordingly.
